title: Complicating curves / Adding Points...
content:
Does anybody know how I can add more points to curves, the opposite of Fontlab's "Transform/Optimize" function.   
   
I require more points as the font is loaded into an interactive environment so more points mean more manipulations for the user.   
   
If anyone knows any ways or software that can do this, please let me know.   
   
Thanks   
Nic
author: nic_mulvaney

comments.content:
Nic, you could add the points in illustrator.   
Don't know if that's an option.

bit late, but in illustrator   
   
edit\>path\>simplify

Also in illustrator.   
   
Filter \> Distort \> Roughen   
Set the distort distance to 0 and add as many points   
per inch as you like. Probably the same as the above.   
   
R
or you can always go in and add more points where you want them directly in fontlab - skip illustrator all together. i don't know of any feature that will automatically do this tho.

FontLab Sutdio 5 will have a new action "Add Nodes" that will do exactly what you're asking for. (Note that there is no official release date for version 5, so please do not ask ;)   
   
Regards,   
Adam Twardoch   
Fontlab Ltd.
